borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">The design of the proposed development is considered unacceptable due to a loss of a important architectural break between the application site and the neighbouring dwelling, No. 18 Manor Road and will lead to the creation of a roof form which does not compliment the original <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kea5gfwizcixw3urh">dwellinghouse</span>. As such, the proposed development is considered contrary to:</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">- The&nbsp;</span><span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kea5ksg9dnu90smmt" style=""><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (MHCLG, February 2019)</span><br></span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">-&nbsp;</span><span style="line-height: normal;"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies 7.4&nbsp;and 7.6 of&nbsp;</span></font></span><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">The London Plan: Spatial Development Strategy for London&nbsp;</span></font><span style="font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">(GLA, consolidated with alterations since 2011, published March&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">2016)<br></span></span><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
